member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Extensions.FormulaCompilerExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for IFormulaCompiler.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Extensions.FormulaCompilerExtensions.GetResult(AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler,System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Compiles a formula and returns the invoked result.
member.param: The IFormulaCompiler instance used to compile the formula.
The formula as a string.
An optional registry where, if required, contains previously populated variables required for the evaluation of the formula.
member.returns: The evaluated result.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler
member.summary: Compiles a mathematical expression provided as a string to a delegate that can be repeatedly invoked for re-evaluation.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler.#ctor(AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The arithmetic operation factory used for building expressions.
The user-defined method factory used for evaluating higher level operations.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompiler.Compile(System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Compiles a formula represented as a string into a delegate that can be repeatedly invoked for re-evaluation.
member.param: The mathematical formula to be compiled.

The registry of variables referenced by the formula that are required for evaluation. This can be populated with all required variables before or after compilation, but before evaluation. If a registry is not provided and the formula contains variables then an instance will be created and provided as part of the result.
member.returns: The compiler result containing the variable registry (if originally provided or variables are found in the formula), the compiled delegate, and a list of variables referenced by the formula (if applicable).

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompilerResult
member.summary: Contains a compiled delegate (resolver) and a list of referenced variables resulting from the compilation of a formula.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompilerResult.VariableRegistry
member.summary: The variable registry reference by the compiled formula. This will be null if the formula compiler was not provided a variable registry and the formula did not contain any variables.
member.remarks: Expected variables (as per ReferencedVariableNames) can be added to the registry after compilation if required.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompilerResult.Resolver
member.summary: The compiled delegate that returns the result of the formula when invoked.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompilerResult.ReferencedVariableNames
member.summary: An enumerable of all variable names explicitly referenced by the formula. This will be null if the formula did not have any variables.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaCompilerResult.#ctor(AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry,System.Func{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.String})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The variable registry reference by the compiled formula. Variables can be added at any time prior to evaluation.
The compiled delegate that when invoked will return the result of the formula.
An enumerable of all variable names explicitly referenced by the formula. This will be null if the formula did not have any variables.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaExpressionFactory
member.summary: Implements a factory that creates expressions required for compiling a formula.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaExpressionFactory.CreateExpression(AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperation,System.Collections.Generic.Stack{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression})
member.summary: Creates an Expression for an arithmetic operation.
member.param: The arithmetic operation to create an Expression for.
Contains the expressions required for processing the required operation.
member.returns: An Expression representing the arithmetic operation.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaExpressionFactory.CreateExpression(System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Creates an expression that gets the value of a variable from the variable registry.
member.param: The name of the variable to get the value for.
The variable registry containing the required value.
member.returns: An expression that gets the value of a variable from the variable registry.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessor
member.summary: Parses a mathematical formula and compiles it to an expression that can be later evaluated.
member.remarks: A compiled expression provides a vast performance benefit when the formula needs to be evaluated multiple times.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessor.#ctor(AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IArithmeticOperationFactory,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.IUserDefinedMethodFactory)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Provides the required support for performing mathematical operations, such as addition, multiplication, and so on.
Provides support for user-defined methods in addition to the built-in library of methods. Refer to the UserDefinedMethodFactory for a list of available built-in methods.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessor.Process(System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Parses a provided formula to create a compiled expression that can later be evaluated.
member.param: The formula to be parsed and compiled into an expression.
The variable registry to be referenced during the formula's evaluation (after compilation).
member.returns: The processed result, including the formula's compiled expression, a collection of any referenced variables, and a variable registry that will be referenced by the compiled expression when it is evaluated.
member.remarks: The variable registry does not need to be provided if the formula does not contain any variables. If the formula does contain variables then there are two use cases. First, if a variable registry is not provided then an instance will be created during processing and will be returned as part of the result. Second, if a variable registry is provided then that instance will be used (and will always be returned with the result, even if there are no variables in the formula). It is the caller's responsibility to populate the variable registry before the compiled expression is evaluated.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessorResult
member.summary: Contains the result of parsing and processing a formula.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessorResult.FormulaExpression
member.summary: Gets the expression built from a processed formula. When this expression is compiled and invoked the value of the formula is returned.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessorResult.ReferencedVariableNames
member.summary: Gets an enumerable of all variable names explicitly referenced by the formula.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessorResult.VariableRegistry
member.summary: The variable registry that will be referenced by the compiled expression during evaluation. This may be null if the formula does not contain any variables.
member.remarks: If the compiler is provided a variable registry then this property will refer to the same reference even if the formula did not contain any variables.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaProcessorResult.#ctor(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Double}},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The expression built from a processed formula.
When not null, a collection of all variable names explicitly referenced by the formula.
When not null, the variable registry that will be referenced by the compiled expression during evaluation.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaTokenProcessorContext
member.summary: Contains context information about a formula token and an associated processor.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaTokenProcessorContext.Predicate
member.summary: The predicate that determines if the processor should be invoked for the provided token.
member.remarks: The input arguments of the predicate include the next token to be read and a flag to indicate if the token is within the context of a user-defined method.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaTokenProcessorContext.Processor
member.summary: The delegate used for processing a given token.
member.remarks: The input arguments of the processor include the next token to be read and a flag to indicate if the token is within the context of a user defined method. The processor returns true to indicate processing is to continue or false to indicate processing of the current scope is complete (such as reading arguments of a user defined method).

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.FormulaTokenProcessorContext.#ctor(System.Func{System.Char,System.Boolean,System.Boolean},System.Func{System.Char,System.Boolean,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The predicate that determines if the processor should be invoked for the provided token.
The delegate used for processing a given token.

member.returns: True if the symbol was registered, otherwise false.

member.summary: Registers a user defined method with the factory using an associated name and operation type.

member.name: T:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.UserDefinedMethodFactory
member.summary: A factory containing user-defined methods that can be evaluated as part of a formula.
member.remarks:
The factory includes the following pre-defined methods:
ROUND: Rounds a number to a specified number of decimal places.
SQRT: Calculate the square root of a number.
CBRT: Calculate the cube root of a number.
LOG10: Calculate the log10 of a number.
LOG2: Calculate the log2 of a number.
LOG: Calculate the natural log of a number.
EXP: Raise 'e' to a specified power.
PERC: Calculate the percentage that one operand is of another.
SIN: Calculate the sine of an angle (in radians).
COS: Calculate the cosine of an angle (in radians).
TAN: Calculate the tangent of an angle (in radians).
SINH: Calculate the hyperbolic sine of an angle (in radians).
COSH: Calculate the hyperbolic cosine of an angle (in radians).
TANH: Calculate the hyperbolic tangent of an angle (in radians).
ASIN: Calculate the angle (in radians) of a sine value.
ACOS: Calculate the angle (in radians) of a cosine value.
ATAN: Calculate the angle (in radians) of a tangent value.
MIN: Returns the minimum of two values.
MAX: Returns the maximum of two values.
ABS: Returns the absolute value of a number.
CEIL: Returns the smallest integral value greater than or equal to a given number.
FLOOR: Returns the largest integral value greater than or equal to a given number.

member.name: P:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.UserDefinedMethodFactory.RegisteredMethods
member.summary: Provides a list of all built-in and custom registered methods.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.UserDefinedMethodFactory.RegisterMethod``1(System.String)
member.summary: Registers an operation type that provides the implementation for a named method.
member.typeparam: The type implementing the registered method.
member.param: The case-insensitive method name being registered.
member.remarks: The operation type is expected to be thread-safe and should therefore not store state.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.UserDefinedMethodFactory.IsRegistered(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates if the requested method name has been registered.
member.param: The case-insensitive method name being queried.
member.returns: True if the requested method name has been registered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Operations.UserDefinedMethodFactory.GetMethod(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an instance of the operation type that was registered using the provided method name.
member.param: The registered method name associated with the operation type to be returned.
member.returns: An instance of the operation type that was registered using the provided method name.
member.remarks: The operation type is only ever created once (per factory instance).

member.param: The operand (argument) to be evaluated.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableFactory.CreateAggregateVariable(System.String,System.Func{System.Double}[])
member.summary: Creates a delegate-based variable that will invoke one or more value resolvers and aggregate their values.
member.param: The name to be assigned to the variable.
The value resolvers to be evaluated and aggregated. These will be re-evaluated each time the created variable is evaluated.
member.returns: The new variable instance.

member.name: M:AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableFactory.CreateAggregateVariable(System.String,AllOverIt.Evaluator.Variables.IVariableRegistry,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a delegate-based variable that calculates the sum of registered variables by their name.
member.param: The name to be assigned to the variable.
The variable registry containing the named variables to be aggregated.
The names of the variables to be aggregated. This cannot be an empty collection. If null is provided then all variables within the registry will be aggregated.
member.returns: The new variable instance.
